com.github.i49.hibiscus.formats

Class HostFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.i49.hibiscus.formats.StringFormat
      • com.github.i49.hibiscus.formats.HostFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Format<JsonString>, Predicate<String>

    public class HostFormat
extends StringFormat
    host and hostport formats which represent Internet host and port.

    Internet host may be either IPv4 address, IPv6 address or Internet domain name. Valid format for host and port is defined by RFC 2396: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax, amended by RFC 2732: Format for Literal IPv6 Addresses in URLs.

    An instance of this format can be obtained by Formats.host() method.

    See Also:
    RFC 2396: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax, RFC 2732: Format for Literal IPv6 Addresses in URLs

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static HostFormat INSTANCE
      The Singleton instance of this format representing Internet host, not followed by port number.
      static HostFormat INSTANCE_WITH_PORT
      The Singleton instance of this format representing Internet host and port number.
